First home owners and smart investors can secure this home that’s sitting on a very handy third of an acre allotment.

Because the land is so big the owners were able to place a 3 car garage alongside, which accentuates the value on offer.

Heating and cooling are taken care of by virtue of a slow combustion wood heater and also a split system air conditioner. Also, the hot water system is only around 2 years old.

Yes this property is in need of some improvements, but a large block like this, means that any improvements that you make will be maximised in later years.
Not far from shops, schools, tafe, hospital.
This is your chance to get into entry level housing that has the scope to grow with your needs as your family expands. Stop paying the landlord and start paying your own rent while interests rates are at historic lows.
The big block of land means subject to council approval you could put a pool in or a granny flat if council approves it, ud have to check to make sure with council this would be ok.

The repayments on this property are likely to be similar to your current rental. 
The thing about this property that stands out from the rest is the BIG BLOCK OF LAND, 3 CAR GARAGE, AND THE UNFINISHED EXTENSION PIECE ON BACK OF HOUSE.
Very good value property

properties.name: BEAUTIFULLY PRESENTED FAMILY HOME IN MOUNT SHERIDAN
properties.description:
Enquiry code for this property: 5093.

This meticulously well-kept home, which was built in 1992 to the previous owners prestigious specifications to be ideally suited for a family, and is surrounded with other quality owner-occupied homes in a quiet cul-de-sac which comprises of:

* Elevated block overlooking the street,
* 3 Bedrooms all with built-in wardrobes and ceiling fans,
* 2 bathrooms,
* Fully air conditioned throughout,
* 2 Living areas with ceiling fans,
* Double lock up garage with remote-controlled roller doors and work benches,
* Wooden feature wall in lounge room with wall mounted flat screen TV,
* 55k litre private in-ground saltwater chlorinated pebble-crete pool with lighting,
* 5KW SOLAR electricity system newly installed (saves about $650 per quarterly bill),
* Small shed inconspicuously tucked away, 
* Separate laundry and toilet,
* Kitchen window has a servery into the outdoor entertainment area for convenience, 
* Skylight in kitchen,
* Two large hallway built-in storage cupboards - also accessible from the bathroom for convenience, 
* Huge walk in pantry,
* Fully security screened windows and sliding doors,
* All windows and glass sliding doors are tinted to assist cooling in the summer heat, 
* Insulated roof and concrete-filled block construction walls, 
* House is cyclone rated, and the yard has excellent drainage for heavy rains, 
* Easily-maintained established gardens and lawn, and
* Private back yard which is fully fenced with side access.

Situated on a 775m2 block, this home could be just the location to start your family, this boutique community is rapidly gaining reputation as the place to live just south of Cairns, with Mount Sheridan Shopping Centre located just 2km’s away. There is also a small IGA, takeaway, and a bottle shop located just a few hundred meters away for those small inconveniences. There are 4 schools located within 2km’s!

You will have a distinguished elevated location plus, all the convenience of a well planned community, close to all amenities, schools, transport, parklands and shopping centres.

Sabine Close is home to many families with children, which becomes obvious after school as the young children play together in the secluded cul-de-sac. 

The functional modern kitchen and dining area open onto the undercover entertaining area overlooking the low maintenance pebble-crete pool, with a neat fully fenced backyard. This home has little to be done, just move in and enjoy being in your dream home. Privacy is not an issue as it is located in a very quiet neighbourhood well shielded from ambient noise. 

WHAT ELSE COMES WITH THE HOUSE?

* The 55 inch Samsung smart TV that is mounted on the living room wall,
* The 50 inch smart TV that is mounted in the master bedroom,
* All window coverings/blinds,
* All plants, pots and gardens,
* Dishwasher,
* Garden and pool lighting which is time-programmed for maximum enjoyment and entertainment,
* Electricity system has dual tariffs for maximum cost effectiveness,
* Work benches and storage racks in garage.

CONSIDERATIONS:

As we have a young child, there are minor stains on the lounge room carpet. Instead of replacing this now, we are willing to provide $1000 towards the cost of replacing them so that you can pick your own style and colour.

The children’s bedroom/nursery has tasteful custom vinyl stickers affixed to the bedroom walls and cupboard which are pictured. They are able to be removed easily if the new owner decides to do so, but they were expensive and we are leaving them on the walls so that they can be enjoyed by the new tenant if desired.

The house is always tidy and clean and we have just had it professionally cleaned; however we are a working family and the house will not be “magazine/showroom ready” at all hours of the day and night. Upon vacating the house after sale, we are willing to again have the inside professionally cleaned to assist with your move. There is literally nothing left for you to do but move in. 

Cairns has previously had cyclones and minor flooding in the past. This house is 24 meters above sea level and is out of the government and council set danger zones for flooding. The house is also constructed to withstand cyclones. The power in Mount Sheridan is underground and the house has not lost power in any storm or emergency yet. This is a very safe and comfortable house in this region. 

PROPERTY INFO:
Lot/Plan – 49/RP749763
Local Government – 2080 Cairns Regional
Land size – 775sqm
Unimproved land value - $146,000 as of 30/06/2015

please contact anytime to organise an inspection.

This is a property for the lover of Tasmanian wilderness, or a getaway offering complete peace and privacy, or as a spiritual retreat - ideal location for an 'Eco-village'.. 

The inquiry code for this property is 1667
You will be asked for the code when you call about this property.

Only 5 minutes to Chudleigh with its general store, post office and primary school, petrol station etc - or 10 minutes to Deloraine with Woolworths, a hospital, doctor’s surgery, library, primary and high school, (school bus at the gate), and a very alternative thriving community. ‘Ingebyra’ is just 20 minutes South of Canberra or Queanbeyan on the sealed end of Williamsdale Road in the peaceful town of Burra.

Four bedroom 1950's worker's cottage, originally part of historic estate, sits on 35.2 acres with original verandah, stained glassed windows, brick fireplaces and long established trees. Across the luscious paddocks a beautiful meandering creek runs through the property aside a small hillside of native trees.

This character filled home has since had french doors and double glazed feature windows added to the living room. As well as solar hot water system and the roof recently repainted and floors re-lacquered. The kitchen splash area and shower recess have been newly tiled.

An outside rustic room close to the main house is the perfect granny flat, teenage retreat or studio with own power, phone and plumbing.

This is the perfect home for the avid gardener and renovator to restore it and add on modern conveniences. What it lacks in modern building it makes up for in charm and half a century old trees. It was purchased ten years ago for 500k and then sold to family for less when became deceased estate. Certainly it is a property with unique potential.

For a short while home to artist Joan Holt, who fell in love with its ambience and set it up for free range chickens for which the property is council approved to run 450. Please go to online tour of listing link to see a live webcam of the property at burra.yabbit.net

properties.name: Your chance to own a slice of Adelaide Hills paradise!
properties.description:
Enquiry code for this property: 6012

This is a rare opportunity to own a slice of Adelaide Hills paradise in the much sought after suburb of Aldgate. A property like this does not come onto the market place often, in fact this is the first time this home will be sold since being built in 1972. This road has numerous homes that have yet to be sold since they were built with them being passed down from family member to family member or still with the original owners. Therefore if you want a chance to own a property in this quiet no-through road, then you must act quickly. 

When you enter this property the stress that has accumulated throughout your day immediately vanishes as you enjoy the picturesque 3441m2 landscaped and native allotment. Put your feet up and relax with a glass of red (or two) as you enjoy the views from the large undercover balcony overlooking several water features with waterfalls. As you take your gaze away from the flora it will not be uncommon to refocus it on the native fauna with the likes of ducks, koalas, kookaburras and even the odd kangaroo as they too enjoy this beautiful setting. 

The first thing you notice as you enter the home is the large open plan living area with a fantastic brand new kitchen! A great design about the open plan living area is that it can also be segregated with large bi-fold doors. The bedrooms are very generous in size with all of them incorporating built in wardrobes. In addition to the master bedroom it has a walk in wardrobe and en-suite. 

There is a workshop/shed as well as plenty of room under the house to create your own personalised space. As well as plenty of space, there is amble off-street parking with a double carport and a garage..

Additional Features:
* Ducted reverse cycle air conditioning
* Dishwasher
* Tasmanian oak floorboards in the living area
* No water bills ever! Self sufficient on larger rainwater storage.
* Fire pump and sprinkler system
* Garden irrigation system
* Vegetable Garden

There for you for your visits to this beautiful area on the back beach side of Old Melbourne Road and/or take advantage of premium holiday rentals (last year income around $25K without much effort) and still with lots of time for private use.

This lovely house with its wrap front veranda sits well back on a large block of private land with native garden, very large driveway (fits cars and boat) and double carport - secure locked gates on both sides of the house to the back garden to keep your family and/or pets safe.

Come in to the entrance hallway from the front veranda with the light filled front living room on your left and main bedroom with walk-in robe and en-suite bathroom on your right.

Further along the hallway opens to the north facing open plan kitchen complete with stainless steel appliances (new LG dishwasher inc), spacious dining area (currently with table and chairs to seat up to 10/12 with lovely garden views at each end) and family room complete with air-conditioning and a Coonara wood fire for those cooler winter months.

There is also ducted heating throughout the house and ceiling fans in each bedroom and the front living room.

This spacious area opens with double french doors to a large northern deck and back garden area - a great area for the kids to play, for entertaining or just taking in the sunshine and sea air. The block behind us is council land that will not be built on and gives a lovely bush ti tree outlook.

To the right of the family room is the bedroom wing - 2 further double bedrooms, both with built-in robes, large family bathroom and separate laundry.

This much loved and cared for, character white and blue timber house is in a great central location, just 10 minutes walk to the No 16 Ocean Beach and barely 5 minutes drive to the Bay, Rye or Blairgowrie shopping areas and many other local attractions. We are at the centre of it all.

Whether you are seeking a new home, a beach retreat or just a getaway from the everyday hustle and bustle, this is a perfect place - situated on a large and very private block in a quiet ti tree lined street amongst quality homes.

The house is only 10 years young and has a lovely atmosphere and spaces for everyone.

Summer, spring, winter or autumn - this home has something for you whether it be reclining on on the large north facing sun deck, snuggling up around the Coonara fire, watching your favourite TV shows with the air-conditioning keeping you cool or taking some time out in the library in the front living space.

PRICE DROPPED FOR QUICK SALE
MAKE AN OFFER

Large 4 Bedroom, Fenced Home on 964m2 with Inground Swimming Pool 

- 4 large bedrooms 

- Main B/R with mirrored built in wardrobe

- Garden Shed 

- Established Gardens 

For those not Familiar with the area, 

Millaa Millaa is a quiet, peaceful village and the home of the World Famous Waterfall Circuit, which includes the beautiful Millaa Millaa Falls, 

Millaa Millaa is 821 meters above sea level on the Palmerston Highway, 59km inland from Innisfail, Nth Qld, in the Cairns Highlands. It is the Eastern access point for the 130km network of walks that form the Misty Mountain Trails, Millaa Millaa is an attractive settlement with a wide and uncluttered Main street, brightened by a vivid display of flowering trees and bushes. The hills around the town are dotted by black & white Friesian cows (Dairy country), lots of green gardens, waterfalls and rainforest. 

Millaa Millaa is the Southern Gateway to the Atherton Tablelands. It has a wealth of wildlife composed of interesting species of flowering trees, bushes, birds and many other land and water animal including possums water dragons and frogs. 

There are more than 13 waterfalls within a short drive from Millaa Millaa, most of them accessible by conventional vehicles and feature picnic facilities with parking areas. All of these Waterfalls are spectacular in their own unique way and most are surrounded by the peaceful serenity of the rainforest. 

Five minutes West of Millaa Millaa, on the McHugh rd is the Millaa Millaa (Gentle Annie) Lookout, it is possibly the most popular lookout on the Atherton Tablelands. You can photograph 180 degree views from the north west to the south east including the distant coastal areas of Innisfail and the volcanic peaks scattered across the Tableland, as well as Mt Bartle Frere, the highest mountain in Qld. 


MILLAA MILLAA FACT SHEET 

* A green/tree change environment all year round 

* Cool climate in the tropics: 2,900 ft above sea level 

* No Droughts, Bush Fires or Floods 

* Great Infrastructure 

- Excellent Primary School (Bus to Malanda for High School) 

- Pre School childcare - Millaa Millaa Children's Centre 

- Ambulance and Health Care Clinic 

- Fire and Rescue 

- Police 

- Post Office 

- Library 

- Beautiful Golf Course with Club House 

- Safe Community 

- Low Cost Land and Housing 

- Good Broadband and Telecommuting 

- Business friendly 

* Right next to the Wet Tropics and Wooroonooran National Park 

* 2hrs to Cairns International Airport 

* Malanda 15-20 mins, Atherton 30-40 mins, Innisfail 45-55 mins 

* Paronella Park 1h 10 mins 

* Mission Beach 1h 30 mins 

* Innot Hot Springs 40 mins

properties.name: A very special place

Resting securely on a hill overlooking the tranquil Lindesay Creek Valley and the majestic border mountain range… a little bit of heaven you can call home. Mountain air invigorates your lungs… the sacred land emits a powerful healing energy. The property has been used as a healing retreat. Lindesay Creek nestles deep in the valley ~ at the very tip of the Northern Rivers ~ by the NSW/Qld border. It’s sacred country.

The local area is known for its natural beauty and is surrounded by many picturesque National Parks and glorious mountain ranges. Many travellers and weekend visitors take advantage of the abundant natural beauty.

The charming village of Woodenbong is only 2.8kms, providing most facilities. The larger regional towns of Kyogle and Lismore are easily accessed… 1hr over the border to Beaudesert and for major cities of Brisbane, Gold Coast and Ipswich it’s only 2hrs away.

The property is 4 hectares (9.885 acres) – 1 acre (approx.) is the fenced house yard with many bird attracting trees and shrubs, vegetable and flower gardens; the soil is good (dark and loamy); there is thought to be water under the ground (has not been investigated) but has a dam and Lindesay Creek is close by. 

Lindesay Creek Road is a no-thru road which finishes at the border. It’s an exceptionally quiet area; most times the only sounds are the birds and the wind rustling the leaves. You can hear yourself breathe in the fresh healing air.

The house ~ of hardwood timber construction is large is in excellent condition and lends itself to many uses ~ workshops, retreats, gatherings, B&B or gallery (with required council approvals). With four bedrooms (two with walk-in areas), a double sized living area and three metre wide covered verandas on three sides… there’s lots of room to stretch out and enjoy your own private space. There are four water tanks and eight solar panels (connected to the grid).

The tranquillity of the area is palpable ~ surrounded by such natural beauty, clean air and abundant natural life ~ it really is a bit of heaven on earth.

Kyogle Council rates are $876.85 per annum.

This very comfortable family home is set high on a hill with 42 acres of arable pasture and creek frontage. The house is positioned for complete privacy and the peace and tranquillity this lifestyle property has to offer must be experienced to be appreciated. The uninterrupted views of the surrounding countryside, established gardens and amazing visiting and resident birdlife make every day feel like a holiday!

Every light-filled room enjoys stunning views from floor length windows and year-round comfort is guaranteed with underfloor slab heating, two fire places and ducted reverse cycle air conditioning.

There are four generously proportioned double bedrooms, all with built in double wardrobes. The master bedroom has an ensuite. A full bathroom and separate WC service the other bedrooms.

The Tassie oak country kitchen offers quality Smeg appliances and a walk-in pantry. The kitchen opens on to a spacious living/dining area which overlooks the sparkling pool and seasonal gardens.

There is a large separate lounge room with its own Jetmaster open fireplace and bar for formal entertaining or for a media room. An informal outdoor entertaining area overlooks the salt water pool and the gardens and covered verandahs offer extra spots to sit, relax, enjoy the views and breathe in the fresh country air.

The house is supplied with ample water from its 90,000 litre water tank that harvests rain from the 400 sq metres of roof. This supply is supplemented by an excellent bore which provides all the water needed for the gardens and stock.
There is a large colourbond shed for the workshop with space for farm equipment and plenty of room to spare. Attached to the house is a double garage and separate office with an extra WC.
A small productive orchard, established vegetable garden and fox-proof chicken coop add to the pleasure of country living. The many trees, shrubs and bulbs in the low-maintenance gardens offer spectacular seasonal colour and interest.

All four seasons can be experienced in this climate and garden. Frosty winter mornings and the bare deciduous trees precede the arrival of spectacular spring blossoms and bulbs. Summer days are warm and the heritage roses and lavender do extremely well in this climate. The low humidity and night breezes ensure a comfortable sleep. Autumn days are crisp and seasonal colour is amazing. Sunsets and rainbows are breathtaking and the clear, clean air means you will experience the most amazing night skies. 

Presently, this lifestyle property runs as a small alpaca stud and also as a Bed and Breakfast establishment. It is the perfect place to entertain your family and friends but be prepared...they will never want to leave! This property is unique and has so much to offer. It just has to be inspected to be appreciated.

Property Features
* 42 acres with spectacular views and creek frontage
* 15 minutes from Bathurst.
* Four double sized bedrooms, main with en suite in western red cedar

* Formal and informal living and entertaining areas

Located at the commencement of the Jacksons Creek Trail, this home allows you to walk right outside your front gate and enjoy kilometres of walking/riding tracks passing playgrounds and beautiful open spaces.

This home features 5 bedrooms; main with his and her walk in robe, ceiling fan and ensuite with double spa. Bedroom 2 & 3 include double BIR’s and ceiling fans, Bedroom 4 has a triple door BIR and Bedroom 5 a double BIR. Bursting with space both indoors and out, this property also plays host to a study and 3 separate living areas including lounge room, living and dining room and a rumpus room boasting large windows overlooking the spacious backyard. In addition to all this, the large multipurpose room, professionally converted from a double garage, has external access and its own split system air conditioner, making it the perfect games room, home office, teenage retreat or even a large, separate 6th bedroom. 

Other features include zoned duct-ed heating and evaporative cooling, alarm system, laundry with triple door linen cupboard and centrally located, open plan kitchen with large windows so you can enjoy watching the outdoors even while you’re indoors.

Outside, the property features a 12m x 6m garage/shed and carport with two roller doors, hooked up to mains power, ready to become the ideal man cave, perfect for storing a boat, jet ski or trailer or as the perfect home workshop for the professional tradie.

Your family will thrive in this big back yard with neat, low-maintenance gardens, large open lawns front and rear, fenced off chicken run, fruit trees and an undercover outdoor entertaining area with roll up blinds to keep out the wind and rain.

The property is well irrigated and eco-friendly, featuring a 20,000 litre water tank with pump, plumbed to a tap at the rear of the house and a 5,000 litre tank supplying the two toilets. In addition, an advanced Taylex sub-surface septic irrigation system provides year round recycled water to the lawn. This eco-friendly system is complemented by a mains irrigation drip system that supplies the well-established trees lining the property boundary, ensuring efficient water use during summer months.

If your family enjoys the feel of country living close to town, then this is the home for you!

properties.name: Fantastic Mountain View! Unique and rare opportunity! A must to see!
properties.description:
Price reduced to sell!

You will love this renovated 4 bedroom, 2 bathroom home with a covered deck/entertainment area and a beautiful oasis like garden, located in a quiet cul-de-sac. 
The interior is fully lined with timber; it is a home with a warm, cozy, cottage feel. Facing north, it gets lots of natural light and the morning sun as well. 

The lounge & dining room is spacious and has big north facing windows to enjoy the vibrant, colorful garden, unique pond, and outstanding, magnificent Mt Wellington view. 
The well sized kitchen has a new ceramic top stove with 2 ovens, many cupboards, and useful working benches. 
Plenty of storage space is offered with 2 good sized built in robes in two of the bedrooms; an additional one is in the hallway. 
NBN fast internet is connected. 

The extensive workshop, a separate building of 27sqm, is another highly appreciated asset to have. It has many windows and could also be used as studio, children's rumpus room, for entertainment or for storage.
The tranquil, beautifully landscaped garden with a big, well established pond, natural stone walls, and pavings, is bird attracting and invites to just relax and enjoy. It gives a feeling of privacy. There is a new garden shed and an underground irrigation system, and space enough to grow some fruit and vegetables in organically treated fertile sandy soil.

The property is fully fenced, child and pet safe. The new driveway allows save off street parking for 2 cars.

The property is maintained very well and leaves nothing for the new owner to stress over. It is inviting, welcoming, and well prepared for the new owner to move in.
The position is close to schools, public transport, services, and shopping centers, and only 15 min. to Hobart.

Kingston is well known as a family friendly suburb. 2 beautiful beaches are close by (5 - 10 min.) which offer a good range of water sports, swimming, snorkeling, kayaking, sailing, and fishing. Enjoyable walking tracks are on the cliffs and around Mt Wellington.

There is a very well established fully fenced yard including a mature Mango tree, a rare triple garage, 4 bedrooms & 2 modern bathrooms - all within a short, flat, stroll to town & transport! From the North facing, sophisticated, pavilion style deck there is a beautiful green outlook in every direction, also great views over the rolling hills beyond the township. There is plenty of space here for the dog too! 

ON THE UPPER LEVEL: From the pavilion deck, enter the home onto the gorgeous, polished wooden floors of the open style, air conditioned living, dining, lounge & kitchen areas, which is perfect for family living & entertaining. There are also 3 good sized bedrooms up-stairs and 2 bathrooms. The spacious master bedroom has a walk-in robe and great sized ensuite . properties.name: Position, Space, Quiet - Position Space, Quiet
properties.description:
Enquiry code for this property: 3648

This townhouse would suit both the investor or owner occupier.

It is located just a short walk to the water, restaurant precinct on the esplanade, the RSL is at the end of the street, it is next door to the school and the Council Library is just across the road, a short stroll away is the Bluewater Shopping Centre for groceries, post office etc. If you are energetic the Tennis Club is virtually across Anzac Avenue. The Council have also just completed a beautification programme of the whole street upgrading the surface of the road, gutters and footpaths. How much better could it be!!!

You arrive home and enter through either the front door or the garage with remote controlled roller door. Internal access through the laundry, downstairs toilet and storage room and you are in the large open plan living/dining area ready to have your first coffee, beer or wine. Open the many massive windows for some sea breeze and you know you are home to relax. The room has a lovely outlook over the garden and courtyard on both sides. This level also has a large kitchen with heaps of cupboard space and the dining area opens out onto the private court yard.

Its time to head on upstairs to the massive master bedroom with gigantic mirrored wardrobe doors which make the room look even bigger and gives loads of storage for your clothes. The bedroom has a private balcony on which you can sip your morning coffee and check out the weather for the day. 

The bathroom upstairs again is massive with two way entry. It is equipped with shower, full sized bath, toilet, and vanity with huge mirror adding to the feel of spaciousness. 

The second and third bedroom are also large and can easily accommodate a queen sized bed. Both have built ins with plenty of storage.
Your sheets and linen can be stored in the decent size cupboard in the hall.

This townhouse is located at the back of the block so there is no passing car or pedestrian traffic to pass your front door offering a sense of security and peace. It's in a small block of only 4 and is self managed so body corporate fees are very low and the exterior has just been painted so not much future work is required.

If you are a gardener there is a small patch of garden for you to test out your green fingers and get creative in. 

The block has two visitor car spaces in the front of the complex. The townhouse is fully fenced so it could be very possible to have a small pet. The garages separate each townhouse so you will not hear your neighbours. It's so peaceful!

If you are a family, couple or single wanting to be alone or share with others you should act fast as this is a rare find in Redcliffe.

properties.name: Cozy Cottage on 1/4 acre block
properties.description:
Phone enquiry code for this property: 3569

This delightful home is the perfect buy for anyone wanting to move in with nothing to be done, slate tiled floors thru kitchen, dining and lounge, Brand new bathroom with modern walk in shower, tile roof, split block brick exterior, double garage with power (currently single with workshop partition), wood heater,
7 solar panels bringing electricity costs way down, large backyard.....excellent soil (this has at times been under cultivation and supplying retail shops in the area, Close to High School and Pre School. 10 minute walk via pathway to town, 10 minutes by car to beautiful beaches, town nestles around scenic Moruya river, Rear deck and partially enclosed pergola area for outdoor entertaining, house is located in a No Through Rd cul de sac. Foxtel hardware installed, front deck to take in the morning sun, privacy ensured by trees and plants along front fenceline, paved parking bay, 3 bedrooms all with built in robes, 2nd toilet and washbasin in laundry, traditional choko vine covered chookyard, fenced garden area, separate library/storeroom or even small 4th bedroom, large studio/family room or whatever meets your need.....currently set up as a music studio and rehearsal room. rear of house fully fenced ...Colourbond steel down one side, high palings at rear, standard palings on other side...front yard is 'fenced" by trees, gardens and shrubbery making a very private environment.
This is a low maintenance house...perfect for a retired couple but with room for a family given the large outside area....very pleasant street setting with well maintained homes and friendly neighbors.
Moruya is the town centre of the 2537 postcode area (pop 7,500). A very cultural centre with 2 major festivals each year, the Granit Festival ( Moruya was the source of the granite for the Harbour Bridge), The River of Art, fortnight long art festival and is 30 minutes away from Narooma which hosts the Great Southern Blues Festival each October Long Weekend. The town boasts a performing Arts Centre, a variety of excellent Restaurants,and a multitude of coffee shops and eateries, well constructed bike paths meander along the river banks through pretty parklands. In the centre of town sits the Moruya golf Course....a popular course for golfers all over the state, Out at the North Head of the river is a TAB sanctioned racecourse that holds regular meetings and a speedway complex....all adjacent to an excellent and safe surfing beach. The town is serviced by 2 large medical Surgeries, a Regional Hospital, radiologists, natural health specialists plus many individual GPs. the Eurobodalla shire council offices and headquarters are situated in Moruya, allowing easy access to council enquiries if needed. Moruya has become a mecca for "foodies" with the S.A.G.E group growing a vast range of produce locally and holding a regular weekly produce market every Tuesday. 
Every Saturday morning Moruya becomes a hive of activity as crowds flock to the huge Moruya Country Market, located in the Riverside park on the banks of the river....this is the largest weekly market south of Sydney and features produce, crafts, food, imports, clothing, pottery, 2nd hand items buskers and the best Pizza you will ever taste!
While this area is popular for retirees its still caters for the youth and active with hockey different codes of football, Nippers, kayaking, Dragon Boats and Skydiving. There are 2 Primary Schools in town, 3 preschools, a well equipped High School and out in Broulee, 2 more High Schools, Carrol College and St Peters College.
and in Moruya a Tafe college,
The beauty of Moruya is that while not actually on the coast road it escapes the holiday madness and retains its relaxed country "vibe"....while the shopping covers most needs (Woolworths and IGA, Large Furniture Store, plenty of Gift Shops and Service outlets, 30 minutes to the north Batemans Bays retail and Industrial area is growing rapidly and for a "full" shopping extravaganza just a quick 2 hour drive up the Kings Highway brings you to Canberra....
Moruya has the best of both worlds.....and with the current turmoil over housing prices you won't find better value for $$$$ than our property...Why are we selling...we are definitely not leaving Moruya but moving and restoring a 1900 Federation home on the river banks!!!

properties.name: An Historic Queensland Colonial Family Home
properties.description:

Please note this 4 digit code VERY carefully as it is required for all phone enquiries.
 
With beautiful corner views from its bull-nosed front verandah revealing the wonderful climate of Toowoomba, this property offers the thoughtful architecture which ensures you will be readily equipped to enjoy each and every season.

It is at once an inner city character home which offers 4 large bedrooms, three of which have built-in robes. It is walking distance from the city yet is tucked away in a quiet pocket, with its purple, jacaranda lined street renowned for the owner's pride in their houses.

Beautifully set on 1085m², the house, with its large backyard, verandah and deck offers ample room for entertaining guests. The paved half court tennis court/ basketball court with brick practice hit-up wall is a wonderful area for children of all ages.

The family bathroom has a claw-foot bath and shower which is set in tasteful patterned tiles. A second separate bathroom with shower and toilet is conveniently placed next to the walk through laundry immediately off the back deck.

The home exhibits character and charm with its polished timber floors and two chandeliers lighting its 11 foot pressed metal ceilings. The large formal lounge has a fan-forced fireplace as its warm heart in winter. The house is insulated and there are outlets for gas heating for year round comfort.

A feature of the home is the massive open plan living and family room. The quality country style kitchen is well equipped with a 4 burner gas stainless steel stove and oven, dishwasher, 2 bowl sink and large corner pantry. It is designed to catch the North-East sun in the mornings and is a joy to wake up to. The bench tops are Tasmanian Oak.

Deciduous trees allow the valuable sunlight to stream in via the large white French windows making it the perfect warm spot in winter and cool from the shade in summer. In addition to the covered open verandah at the front, there is a northern facing covered deck at the rear leading to the generous backyard.

Two street access to the property is available from the paved driveway via an ornate remote control gate which leads to the two car carport and also from double corner gates in the back yard.

The large separate laundry also has built-in benchtops, overhead cupboards and space for a large top loading washing machine and dryer. Instant gas hot water has also been installed where the temperature can be handset by touchpad in a number of convenient locations.

Inspections by appointment.

properties.name: ICONIC TENTERFIELD PROPERTY: A piece of history at an affordable price
properties.description:
Phone enquiry code for this property: 3673

DELORAINE, CIRCA 1870
Deloraine is a heritage listed bluestone homestead offering 3 bedrooms and a separate, self-contained guest cottage. It is situated on a 3794 square metro block in the town precinct with established gardens and trees. The building could serve as a family home and/or as a guest accommodation facility, should you have the desire to continue the established bed and breakfast operation. You can take advantage of the commercial kitchen and expand the business to provide light meals in the historic dining room and sunny atrium. The house and gardens also lend themselves to cater for weddings and functions. Or you can simply relax and enjoy the clean air, slower paced lifestyle and friendly country town atmosphere that Tenterfield offers.

Tenterfield is located at the junction of the New England and Bruxner highways in NSW. It is a short 3 hour drive from Brisbane, 2.5 hours from Byron Bay and 8 hours from Sydney. This historic town, thanks to Sir Henry Parkes, is the birthplace of Australia's federation and was immortalized in Peter Allen’s tribute to his grandfather, the Tenterfield Saddler. The town offers a range of tourist attractions - granite belt wineries, picturesque hiking trails, Thunderbolt country - and is surrounded by magnificent national parks.

Enjoy living in an environment that has four distinct seasons: flowers announcing the arrival of spring, warm summers, autumns filled with brilliant red and gold colours, and sunny winter days with clear, crisp nights. 

If you are considering a change in lifestyle: a tree change; semi retirement with a small business to operate; better value for money away from the high-cost city property markets, this is an opportunity that cannot pass you by. At a sales price of $625,000 Deloraine offers excellent value for your property dollars.

For a closer look, visit the Deloraine Tenterfield website.

General features
3 Bedrooms in the main house (including one with ensuite)

Fully self-contained guest cottage
Commercial kitchen, large dining room and café style atrium
2 Car garage and off-street parking for 11 vehicles

properties.name: Riverstone Sanctuary
properties.description:
Phone enquiry code for this property: 3792

Bellingen has been described by Australian travel magazines as the new Byron Bay, but what locals have always known is there is something else, enchanting and untouched, that is unique to Bellingen alone. 

Up the quiet Darkwood Road, along the Bellinger River and past a forest full of flooded gums, sits two houses and several acres.

From the wide deck area spanning three quarters of the house, is a view so close to the river frontage you could throw a stone into it. So close, if you wake up early enough, you can glimpse the elusive platypus in its natural habitat. 

When the smell of fire warms the dusk afternoon, you can take solace inside this house built from Australian timbers. Due to its passive thermal design, in summertime too this house stays nice and cool. 

But come night-time all year round, the stars and glow worms will be competing for your attention. 

With surrounding Japanese-inspired gardens built up over 15 years and a 100+year old Red Cedar tree standing prominently in the front yard, here, nature and home are almost indistinguishable. 

Main Features
•	Half a km of pristine river frontage – you can drink the water straight from the river
•	Park like property - size 8.5 acres. Two large fenced pastures with a water trough. 
•	Spring fed water from rainforest creek to drink
•	Pristine river 10m from the house to swim in.
•	Swim in the rock pool 20m from the deck of the house or swim 50m in the river from your own private grassy river flat
•	sit on the veranda and watch the platypus
•	Beautiful Japanese garden surrounding the house
•	River banks have been regenerated and are weed free
•	River banks covered in established red cedars and regenerated rainforest
•	Ancient red cedar tree is the focus point of the garden
•	Contemporary hand made built home from Australian milled timbers such as red Mahogany cladding, Australian red cedar window frames, tallow wood decking and feature rosewood and teak timber inside the home
•	Granite and stainless kitchen. Kitchen has beautiful walk in pantry. Contemporary stove and drawers. Watch the fish in the river as you cook in the kitchen
•	Open plan living with a series of double opening doors on the veranda
•	Passive solar designed home
•	Main house has a large main bedroom with a storeroom or second bedroom.
•	Guesthouse has a one bedroom, open plan living with kitchen and bathroom. The guesthouse has plenty of room for a sofa lounge for extra guests.

Perfect Queensland aspect - North/North East 180 degree panorama from Moreton Island to Mount Coolum as well as totally uninterrupted views from the escarpment to the Coast.

An original 1950's renovated 3 bedroom bungalow set on 1.136 hectares of rich volcanic soil supporting an exceptional garden featuring tropical, native (for the varied bird life), and formal parterre areas. This combines for a delightful lifestyle and living area.

This magnificent property cannot be built out. It is very private and within walking distance to the iconic village of Montville. One and a half hours drive to Brisbane CBD and half and hour to Maroochydore airport.

The arty home and garden have been featured in several lifestyle magazines as well as a country garden book. Wedding ceremonies, photographs and location shoots have taken place in the garden.

There is plenty of room to build your dream home on the escarpment overlooking the coastline or continue the garden -

 old Chinese proverb "a garden is not about the end result but about the journey".

properties.name: Time for a Bush Change? Then Westonia is just the place!
properties.description:
Phone enquiry code for this property: 4080

Looking for buyers for a newly built property in Westonia. The concrete slab, steel framed, colourbond house is on a large block (1012m2), covering 272 of those square meters, including a huge 142.8 m2 of veranda. There is also a large 9x6m powered shed and 45.6m2 powered carport.

There are still a few small jobs yet to be finished on the outside, sellers are intending to concrete the shed floor and the verandas, however they are also happy to look at offers from anyone interested in finishing it themselves.

The living area is open, with dining, tv and kitchen blending together easily. There is a huge main bedroom with walk in closet and two more good sized rooms, one with a built in closet and the other lending itself to a great office/study. Both the laundry and bathroom are also large, with a huge 900x1200 glass shower, and there is a separate water closet. There is plenty of storage with huge built-in laundry cupboard, built-in linen cupboard, and a large walk in pantry for the kitchen. The house is fully insulated (roof and walls), with a 3hp reverse cycle air conditioner in the living area, and also has a split system solar hot water system. There is easy care vinyl flooring throughout, with tiles to the laundry, bathroom and toilet.

The outside of the property has huge potential. There is a water stream feature at the front of the property, which will be gorgeous once completed. All other sections are a blank canvas ready for a green thumb. The huge veranda area could be closed off if desired, to produce an amazing outdoor living space.

The property is situated in the beautiful, quiet, friendly town of Westonia. For more information about the town please head to www.westonia.wa.gov.au. Westonia is only 35 mins from Merredin, a major town with service, retail and industrial sectors, as well as a Hospital and large K-12 school. Westonia has a visiting doctor once a month, as well as weekly visits from a Nurse Practitioner. There is also a working gold mine (Edna May - Evolution Mining) next to town, which provides many work opportunities. This also provides great rental potential.

The Wheatbelt is an amazing place to live, with (contrary to popular belief) many wonderful places to visit as well as a vivid pioneering history. So for anyone looking for a "bush change", Westonia is the place for you!

If possible, a long settlement, or re lease until the end of 2015 would benefit the sellers.

properties.description:
The enquiry code for this property is 1289
Please note this 4 digit code VERY carefully as it is required for all phone enquiries.

Eagles Eyrie takes its name from the Eagles flying in the sky over the lodge and mountain ranges at Eaglereach and their nesting place. Eagles Eyrie is an exquisite North facing mountain top retreat. It is a loft bedroom residence located on 1.2 acres
of freehold land, which is, in turn, part of a 1000 acre community title development, located near Vacy, in the Paterson Valley. Most of the land remains virgin bush, waiting to be explored on the walking and 4WD trials, there are also dams which
provide good fishing. Located approximately 2.5 hours from Sydney, and 1 hour from Newcastle and the adjoining Hunter Valley, this is your ultimate living retreat and the place to relax and unwind. There are a couple of golf courses 45 mins drive away.


Eagles Eyrie is a quality, well maintained loft style designed timber residence, similar to a Swiss chalet. Perfectly located at the end of its own individual bush driveway away from the main access road, the home is a combination of cosy home comforts and features a bathroom with a double shower, toilet and bidet and also an indoor spa for your enjoyment. The lounge and dining area offer spectacular and breathtaking views over the Moonabung Ranges. The lodge has air conditioning and a slow burning combustion fire for those cool winter evenings. Whether it’s summer or winter your comfort is assured. Relax on the large north facing deck, which offers outside living at its best with an outdoor heated spa, for an atmosphere of romantic seclusion complete with the fantastic views of the Barrington Tops and gaze across the immediate country side. At the resort there is a swimming pool, tennis court, walking trails and other facilities available to the owners of this residence.

This beautiful loft style chalet is available fully furnished if required with quality furniture and fittings.

This residence would make a beautiful home for a couple wanting a life of relaxation and perfection in this beautiful wilderness area. It also can serve as a wonderful holiday retreat, as well as a fantastic holiday rental opportunity.

With the majority of rural properties, you have to be prepared to compromise. You have to choose between budget and an acreage which satisfies your wishlist. Between position and an acreage that looks and feels just right. Or between the number of rooms and the number of selling points. With this property, things are different. It lets you have your cake and eat it too...
 
Suited to your needs? Of course! It’s a match made in heaven if you want the country lifestyle.
 
Location? It’s only a 15 minute drive from CBD and a 25 minute drive from Bargara. 
 
The right visual appeal and feel? Absolutely! It’s a beautiful acreage with well established gardens and fish pond with waterfall and fountain that makes the property feel restful and relaxed.
 
Number of rooms? Without a doubt! This two storey recently renovated house boasts 5 bedrooms in all, as well as a guest accommodation with all amenities, galley kitchen, large covered balcony, home office, study nook, laundry, under stairs storage room and established vegetable garden with green house.
 
And high points? It has loads of those too, including massive 4 bay lockable shed with workshop including tractor and implements, licensed bore (12 Megalitre) including irrigation pipes and 3 x 5,000 gal tanks. 
 
At just $530,000, and with so many great features, this acreage won't wait around for long. Don't be too late. Call now to schedule an inspection.

Are you looking for somewhere peaceful and tranquil to live? Frankland River is situated in the Shire of Cranbrook, Western Australia, and is a grape and olive growing area as well as sheep and cattle farming. 

Built 17 years ago, this house is situated in a valley, on the edge of the Frankland River town site, overlooking farmland. The school, shop, community centre, cafe and country club are all within easy walking distance. 
Close to beautiful bush land, the house does not overlook nearby neighbors.

The garden covering 1 1/3 acres (5500 square metres) has three sheds, a shade house, fruit trees, grape vines and vegetable beds. The main part of the garden is Australian native shrubs and trees and is home to many species of birds. There is a blue metal drive, leading to a single carport. 

House has three bedrooms, two bathrooms. Main bedroom has ensuite and large walk-in robe with hanging space and shelving. 
 Open plan living, large dining area and lounge. Dining area has a large window overlooking the garden. 
The custom designed kitchen has a large walk-in pantry. Cooking is with gas top and electric oven. Plenty of bench space, and good quality cabinets. Double sink and draining boards. 
The laundry is L shaped with room for a washing machine and freezer.
Small entry hall with room for large storage cupboards and desk for computer. 
Large aluminium windows giving lots of natural light, providing an attractive vista to garden and farmland. Sliding doors open onto the back veranda; a great place to relax and entertain. The kitchen has a large bay window. All windows and door have deadlocks. 
Ceramic tile floors in main living area, main bedroom, bathrooms and laundry. Vinyl floor tiles in two smaller bedrooms.
Water is heated by instantaneous gas heater. Heating and cooling by a reverse cycle air-conditioner and a gas fire. 
Verandas back and front. 
Front veranda is enclosed making it safe for child or small dog.
Steel framed, zincalume roof. 

Could be bought as an investment house as there is always a need for rented properties in the area.

100m from the swimming lagoon, delivers you to this freshly renovated, immaculately presented two bedroom unit. The unit is freshly painted throughout as with new energy efficient down lights and a stunning new kitchen. Open the rear sliding door and kitchen window to let the sea breeze flow throughout the unit. The grounds are maintained by an employed gardener who attends to the grass and watering the garden beds and is paid for within your body-corporate fees. 150m to the bus stop, 200m from the patrolled Kelly's beach and just around the corner from the golf course. Fish, swim or leisurely stroll into this new lifestyle that is just waiting for you...

The master is an over sized bedroom with a huge floor to ceiling window and an abundance of space for a king sized bed suite. One wall is a dedicated robe with doubled mirrored glass sliding doors hiding plenty of shelving and hanging space. The new down lights operate on two separate switches and an overhead fan. 

The joining bathroom has an, over proportioned shower 150cm x 110cm, full vanity unit and large window, new IXLtastic, and tap wear.

The toilet/powder room has it's own vanity. It has a new toilet cistern, down light and new tap wear all complementing the oversized mirror.

The second bedroom is a long queen size room with built in floor to ceiling robes with sliding doors, two new down lights, overhead fan and a high window capturing the sea breeze.

The spacious passage has one wall dedicated to linen and storage and new down light.

The dining room sits comfortably off the side of the fresh new kitchen and, is filled in winter with morning sunshine. The gorgeous new lighting fixture illuminates the floor to ceiling sliding door that looks out into your own private backyard. Opening the doors and windows to let in the sea breeze cools the house during summer.

With a brand new kitchen that includes all new cabinetry, black glassed electric cooktop, stunning stainless steel oven and range hood, polished finished black granite looking bench tops and a green wrap around glass splash back. It has new lighting, wiring, plaster and fresh paintwork. It also features a breakfast bar with its own lighting.

Hidden behind the front door is a vestibule for you hats, coats, golf clubs and fishing rods.

The floor to ceiling front window frames your garden entrance to the front door. It welcomes you into such a large inviting lounge room with a newly double glassed display/library cabinet sitting majestically beside the breakfast bar. The lounge also has 2 overhead fans, dual split system, and all new energy efficient down lights and paintwork.

An internal sliding door lets you enter the long single car garage and laundry with a new security door that leads you out into your private backyard and clothesline. Running almost the length of the garage is an overhead shelf for your storage solutions.

Through out the beautiful unit is wood patterned vinyl strip flooring, floor tiles in wet areas and no carpet at all. The backyard is deceiving bigger than you would expect and just waiting for your inspirations to come to life.

The unit complex is positioned beside a beautifully maintained evergreen Park with a children,s full play ground.

The complex is friendly and inviting place and is well managed with low body corporate levies of $1,775 per year.

An inspection is highly recommended and it will not disappoint. This unit will not last long as all renovations have been done with time, love and patience for your piece of mind.

First time offered, in nearly 15 years, in this tightly held onto, sought after area. This stunning home will draw you inside, to experience its beauty, from your first sight of it. The home's coveted North/South orientation takes full advantage of all the surrounding natural elements.

Once you pass through the beautiful, lush, shady tropical gardens, filled with many delights, and enter this huge home, via exquisite new balustrading, quality large porcelain tiles and entry door, you are sure to be further delighted by the luxury, quality fittings this home showcases. With beautiful new crystal chandaliers, gold switch plates, and newly polished solid hard timber flooring, throughout the top floor, combined with brand new plantation shutters and quality custom made luxury swag and tail curtains, this home boasts a lot of class.

A large modern, fully renovated 2-pac kitchen, continues the luxury upstairs, with a huge stainless steel Blanco gas cooktop, complete with fish burner & wok burner, as well as a complementing stainless steel Blanco electric wall oven, and a brand new fully intergrated Electrolux stainless steel dishwasher & WasteMaid Insinkerator Food Disposal Unit. All this luxury leads you out onto a wide balcony, again with exquisite balustrading and porcelain tiles, overlooking a sparkling newly renovated, quality, concrete, inground, salt water, lagoon pool, surrounded by very private, sanctuary-like tropical gardens and the sound of natural bird life, giving you the feeling you could be anywhere, and yet you're only 15kms from Brisbane's CBD.

There is a further 2nd kitchen downstairs, and ample space for dual living, with a huge open living area, currently being used as 4 separate areas, all within this space, plus a bar and gym area, leading through a door into the roomy, lock up garage, that has housed 3 large vehicles all at the one time. There is a small workshop/toolshed, and also another generous sized powder room, housing a 2nd toilet and wash basin, at the back of the garage.

This home is one of those you don't see come onto the market very often, and it probably won't be back on again for many years to come.
Don't miss this opportunity to take up a rare, prime position, and all this home has to offer. The value of these much sought after homes, will only ever increase over time. Please don't delay in making an appointment to come and privately view this spectacular property, before it's too late.

properties.name: Lovely place for a tree change
properties.description:
The phone enquiry code for this property is 3340.

Echidna Gully is one of the most picturesque properties in Bullsbrook where you can have your tree change yet stay in Perth.It has a lot to offer. 

At the gateway to the beautiful Chittering Valley which promises to be Perth’s next big tourism area, it is just 20 minutes from the iconic Swan Valley and only half an hour from Midland. 

With almost 29 acres of hills, views, walk trails, a winding winter brook and all kinds of birds and animals including echidnas that give it its name, this property is like a miniature national park.

Yet it has some practical flat areas where you can do your own thing, including a large powered riding arena and holding yards with a horse shelter and shed, and a big area to establish a paddock.

The property has commercial potential as a visitor attraction. 

The owners are reluctantly retiring and downsizing, and have drastically reduced the price.

Features of this property include:

A 4x2 plus large study chalet style cedar and iron home of about 155 square metres with a verandah all around and stunning valley views. Reverse cycle air con in main living area and three other rooms. Well equipped kitchen with new 90cm stainless steel oven. Pine cathedral ceiling and beams in main living area with wood heater, most floors stone tiled.

Own water system with plenty of roof catchment area feeding a 20,000 gallon tank and septic system (so no water/sewerage charges!)

Home is surrounded by easy care gardens with a 50-square metre rear patio - steel structure with colorbond roof, lighting and fans.

Outbuildings include a large double garage, small garden shed and two large aviaries/animal pens. There is also an old weekend shack with power and water tank.

Underground power to horse yard, shack and house.

Large spring-fed dam with a number of fruit trees including mandarins.

Potential for a productive bore near the horse area.

Only 8km from Bullsbrook which is experiencing rapid growth and has a school, surgery, vet, shops and sporting facilities including bowling club with new artificial green.

properties.name: Private Slice of Paradise
properties.description:
The enquiry code for this property is 1520
You will be asked for the code when you call about this property.

Nestled in the rolling hills and lush green valleys of the Noosa Hinterland, this 3 bedroom renovated cottage is perfect for those seeking a quiet country lifestyle. 

The cottage is next to a large in ground pool (fully fenced), surrounded by established tropical gardens. The cottage also overlooks one of four spring fed dams, which attract a myriad of wildlife that include; Wallaby, kangaroos, (resident) Azure Kingfishers, Egrets, Cormorants, migratory and native Duck species, native (snake neck and other species) of Freshwater Turtles, as well as Yabbies, fish, and even (sometimes) White Bellied Sea Eagles just to name a few species. 

You do not even have to leave the house to view all these incredible creatures, and no music is necessary as the melodious singing of the birds far out shines any sound of human creation. An additional house site exists on the top of the property overlooking your very own 21+ acres of paradise, as well as valleys and mountains for kilometers around. 

There are roads throughout the property making everything easily accessible, and the famous Noosa Trail Network is immediately accessible straight from your own land. One of the most amazing things about the location of this property, is the proximity to Noosa. A short 25 minute drive to Hastings Street, and the many other necessities and attractions Noosa provides, makes this property ideal for people seeking the seclusion and privacy of rural living, but who do not want to be cut off from the conveniences of coastal living.

Charming renovated brick and iron roof home with four large double bedrooms, a Federation style bathroom with clawfoot bath, and a country kitchen that blends the heritage features with modern appliances and functional design.

This historic home sits at the top of 10 gently sloping acres of fully fenced grazing pasture with mature trees and rocky outcrops.

The home retains original wide jarrah floor boards, pine ceilings, sash, windows,feature fireplaces, and wood fired kitchen oven.

The extensive renovations include jarrah french doors that open the house onto its peaceful and panoramic valley views. A cosy nook on a raised level is a peaceful space to relax, currently used as a home theatre.

The kitchen is fitted with European electric oven with gas cooktop, and dishwasher.
The home is heated in Winter by a Kent log fire, and cooled in summer by air con and fans.

Water is pumped from a year round reliable bore to a new 23,000 litre poly tank, and there is a 4,500 litre rainwater tank for the garden.

The thriving farming town of Toodyay is just 7 kilometres away. The town is a popular weekend tourist destination and won the 2015 Tidy Town Australia award.

With its own well respected District High School, and the Avonlink passenger railway connection to Perth, Toodyay is a growing and caring community, with its own medical practice and dentist. The Wheatbelt town of Northam has a modern hospital and emergency department, and is just twenty minutes away.

Toodyay is a historic town with a rich history. It is a very popular weekend tourist destination, with its arts and crafts, cafes, restaurants, and old fashioned country pub culture..

Midland is a 45 minute drive, and Perth is just 80 kilometres away.

Built in 1878 during the early pioneer days of Australia, The School House, the iconic and quintessential Queenslander of Port Douglas, is now a breathtaking residence offering seclusion and luxury. Set in lush tropical gardens on exclusive and renowned Flagstaff Hill with views across the sea to the mountains beyond, the property is an oasis in the centre of town - only a short stroll to Four Mile beach and yet just a step away from Macrossan Street, the location is ideal.

French doors opening onto broad Queensland verandahs – style and elegance. Cool polished Cypress timber floors and air-conditioned comfort. This is a rare opportunity to acquire a unique property with a rich history, it is the oldest building in the area, located at one of Port Douglas’ top addresses, there is nothing else like it. 

The house offers open plan living with soaring cathedral ceilings, a large chef’s kitchen, complete with an island bench that flows seamlessly into the dining area and on to the inviting lounge area – perfect for entertaining. There are a total of five bedrooms or four bedrooms and office, the master with ensuite and dressing room, together with spacious guest bathroom, built-in robes, pantry/laundry and store. 

“…The School House was exactly what I had been dreaming of. It had twelve foot wide verandahs and when you opened up the main doors the outside world came in – the breezes, the sweet perfumes, the lush greenery of the garden. The interior was cool and creamy white…” Booker Prize winning author Peter Carey. 

Set on a large 1181 sq.m. parcel of land with a significant 40m frontage to Murphy Street and driveway off Owen Street the property offers a number of opportunities for use either as an exclusive residence or as an investment with multiple income streams available from holiday accommodation, art gallery, café and bed and breakfast – all with current council approvals. There are also council approvals in place for two additional buildings on the Murphy Street frontage and a third at the rear of property.

A once in a lifetime opportunity to own this unique and prestigious property that combines an enviable residence, holiday retreat and investment. 

Features
•	Unique 1878 building

•	On Flagstaff Hill with views across the sea to the mountains

Why It Is Being Sold Below Replacement Cost you might ask?

Well, as a builder that was taught "Old School Methods" where you build to last, when you build your own home, your guaranteed to add all the bells and whistles, right? 

Exactly,.....you're going to add all the fixtures and finishes that most people could never afford when they build. 

Let's face it, labour costs are the most expensive part of building, but as a builder building your own home, you never add up how many hours you've actually spent on the work, you just do what ever it takes it get it right.

What typically happens next is, you make use of the home to market your building skills for a number of years, right up until your kids start to grow up and then it's time to down scale and build again.

Now is that time, and here lies that opportunity for one lucky buyer to secure the 'BUY OF A LIFE TIME' .

You get to move in and enjoy this family home masterpiece from day 1 and for less than what it will cost you to build it YOURSELF!

properties.name: 'Killara' 2,020 ha of Freehold title. Double River Frontage. Original Homestead.
properties.description:
Enquiry code for this property: 3922

'Killara' 2,020 hectares (4991.53 acres) freehold title of beautiful grazing country in the Horton Valley.
Held with one family for 137 years. A first time offer.
(Please use enquiry code 3922 when you call Property Nowl)
This lush property not only boast Double River Frontage on the Horton River, but also 800 hectares of prime breeding and fattening county, with flat native pastures, quality soil and constant water supply, perfect for growing grass fed cattle.
Stock can graze on the entire property including the 607 hectares of private native forestry title with Cypress Pine, Iron Bark, and Box timber.
The Horton River is fast flowing perennial water-way and the only North running river in NSW. Flowing into the Gwydir River, the Horton is part of the Murray-Darling system.
This property is very versatile, suited to running cattle, sheep or a combination, plus the added advantage of selling timber and cultivation.
 ‘Killara’ (Aboriginal for ‘always there’) established in 1878 has run Cattle, Merino sheep and race horses.
A tastefully restored 4 bedroom Homestead, built in 1902 using timber milled from the property, still in superb condition. A rich interior with 3 large covered veranda’s, a rare double guttering system, tiled fire places, 4 large double bedrooms, a formal dining room, kitchen with a separate walk in pantry room, lounge room, family room, original floor boards, 4m ceiling, 32 original doors, unique diagonal woodwork walls and original fixtures. You can feel the grandeur in this modern functioning home.
‘Killara’ also has:-
A second 3 bedroom home 
A rustic 2 bedroom Cottage with renovated traditional fire lit hot water system and a BBQ area. Perfect as a farm stay holiday letting.
All buildings stand on high ground with 360 degree distant mountain views.
The large 4 stand Wool Shed, is like stepping back in time 
The 450m2 TWO story shelter shed is phenomenal. Holding approx 1000 sheep on the top level with grain storage plus lower level storage for sheep.
Large stockyards, machinery shed, 4 stables and shearers quarters 
Property fed by river water.
All with electricity.
7 Dams
Mail is delivered 3 days a week.
The Bingara School bus runs past the door.
Bingara is 40km (40 minute drive) .Located at the heart of the Fossickers Way, one of the oldest & most scenic route in NSW which is an alternative touring route between Sydney and Brisbane. (Population 1300 in 2011) Bingara is a tranquil town with a vibrant community, shops, hotels, parks, pool, cafes and supplies.
Note ‘Killara’ is Located 110 km south-west from Inverell, 90km south-east from Moree, 192 km north of Tamworth, 489 km north of Sydney NSW 
Note: On Google maps address search address as 2662 Caroda Road, Elcombe, New South Wales

properties.description:
Enquiry code for this property is 1951

BEARWOODS – Is just 7Kms from IMBIL village.

This private beautiful bush block is set on 10 forested acres abounding with wildlife including koalas, phascogales, gliders, echidnas, wallabies and over 70 species of birds identified, to name a few.
Established walking tracks guide you around through the orchard, past the veggie garden (both fully irrigated), dam and frog pond continuing through the eucalypt forest, crossing little bridges over the gullies in a circumnavigated walk back to the main house.

It will be hard to find a better maintained bush block than this. Offering privacy and tranquillity yet still close to major centres. Less than 45mins to Noosa, 35mins to Gympie, 25mins to Cooroy and just 2hrs to Brisbane. The pretty well-serviced village of Imbil is less than 10 minutes away. School bus pick up at top of property.
Services include: Primary to Year 10 School, Day Care Centre, Post office, Doctor, Pub, Grocery store & Fuel, Café, Hardware and Gift shops.

The House is a 3 bedroom lowset 1930s workers cottage with high ceilings, polished timber floors, original partly stained glass ornate windows, VJ walls, recently renovated solid timber open plan kitchen with breakfast bar, with large glass windows taking in the views over the tree tops to the hills beyond. A large partially undercover deck adjoins the rear of the house and wraps around to the west of the house to where the sunken Jacuzzi bath sits…perfect for relaxing with a glass of champagne as you watch the sun go down over the distant hills and maybe catch the silhouette of a squirrel glider going about its night time routine.

There are two living areas, a recently renovated hardwood timber bathroom, study, classic veranda at the front of building, two Bay Garage plus Workshop. Has Solar hot water and a 1.5kw solar system which feeds into the grid (with 2.1kw inverter - so upgrade achievable at low cost) Three 5000 gallon water tanks. We have never run out of water in 11 years!
Additional accommodation is available in the rustic pioneer style, self-contained Cabin. It is far enough away from the house to give privacy. The cabin can sleep up to 7 people. It has an outdoor undercover kitchen, outdoor shower set in amongst palms and ferns, an outdoor bath that can be heated by the coals of the fire. At present it offers a King size bed in the gallery loft room. The Solar hot water can be backed up by a wood burning stove. Can see more about cabin on our website: imbilkayakandbike.com

This would make an ideal teenage retreat, guest accommodation, rental or holiday let.
It is currently let out as a popular holiday let.

For further information or to arrange a personal inspection of BEARWOODS contact us today.

General Features

•	Bathrooms:1

Riverside tranquillity, built on a standard block for comfortable and efficient living by the current owners 45 years ago. As a professional couple we needed a house which combined convenience in all aspects with minimum requirements for up-keep of both house and garden. 

Over the years it has been extended and refurbished to care for an expanding family and to maintain that comfort and convenience. 
Its 260 sq metres of living space features a split level design with kitchen, dining, and lounge areas facing north, fronted by an extensive tiled patio, overlooking the river. Summer shade is provided by a purpose-designed removable canvas awning.

The upper level has 3 bedrooms and a bathroom, separate shower room, and a toilet room. An architect designed master bedroom area was added later, with en suite bathroom, walk-in wardrobe and study.

Underneath is a lower level “Granny flat” with its own bathroom and kitchen facilities, a garage/workshop, and an extensive storage area. There is a double carport under the master bedroom area.

Heating is all electric with under-floor cables in the living area slab (Thermostatically controlled) and storage block heaters in other areas.

The high pitched, tiled roof is ideally situated for future Solar Panel installation on the North facing surface.

Whilst having a rural outlook, a few minutes walk along the picturesque river bank track brings you into the main street of the town. 

Wynyard is a major historic country town, with good shopping and social facilities and is situated on the estuary of the Inglis River, in the shadow of Table Cape, on the North-West Coast of Tasmania. 
With retirement, it is time to down-size, so we now, reluctantly, put our beloved family home on the market.

properties.name: Luxurious Inner City Living with an Ecological Edge
properties.description:
Enquiry code for this property is 2381. You will be asked for the code when you call about this property.

THREE NEW BENCHMARK ECO-TERRACES

Crafted with an exemplary environmental focus, these unique Torrens Title terraces set a new benchmark in modern design and liveability. An abundance of environmental features include a native green roof complete with maintenance contract, low-VOC interiors water tanks & solar power. 

State-of-the-art thermal design, insulation and glazing ensure high levels of comfort throughout the year with extremely low utility bills. These dwellings epitomise well-appointed sustainable living for Sydney in the 21st Century. 

STUNNING ARCHITECTURE

Each of the three properties affords three bedrooms, two and a half bathrooms, a study, and a lock up garage designed to be converted to a fourth bedroom for car-free residents (STCA). Stunning retractable glass roofs are designed to deliver a fabulous sense of open space with abundant natural light and ventilation throughout. The staircase hovers over a pond, whilst kitchen spills into dining, living, and outdoor entertaining. A balcony with custom-designed operable privacy screens creates a true parents retreat. 

ALL INCLUSIVE

Finishes include high efficiency lighting and appliances, crafted timberwork, timber floors, and natural stone tiles & benchtops. 
Additional amenities such as bicycle parking, a herb and vegetable permaculture garden, built-in BBQ, extensive storage, and family-size laundry complete the package. Conveniently located for a city lifestyle these homes are minutes to transport, cafes, parks, schools and countless other local amenities.

INSPECT & REGISTER NOW

The project’s architect & builder, Oliver Steele, continues to refine and customise layouts, finishes & fixtures during construction. We invite interested parties to register their interest and take a tour of the site pre-completion. 

Completion is due in July 2015, to be Auctioned in August 2015.

This is a rare opportunity to secure an enviable piece of Newtown history.

properties.name: Lakefront home with a unique over 50's lifestyle package
properties.description:
Ever considered living in one of those luxurious over 50's lifestyle resorts but can't give up the privacy of your own backyard? Well look no further. This home is 5 mins from the beach, close to all amenities and is set on a 450 sqm very private, fenced allotment that backs onto a lake. Put simply, it's irreplaceable as it offers security and companionship, whilst still retaining a residential allotment.

This architecturally designed home has only been lived in for 2 yrs and is absolutely as brand new. The garage is large enough to fit two large cars easily, has seamless flooring and a r/c door. The main bedroom with ensuite is extra large and positioned over the lake, catching the beautiful sea breezes. Even the 2nd and 3rd bedrooms have built ins. There is a 4th bedroom or study also looking over the lake. A large family room also is positioned to catch the water views and sea breezes. There is a separate powder room for guests. The kitchen is ultra modern with two PAC cupboards, stone bench tops and stainless steel appliances. 

The large, shady back yard is a beautiful place to hang out, as there is always various forms of wildlife on the lake including ducks, swans, albatross, turtles. A paved deck right on the water is a wonderful place to relax. Or why not go fishing in it? All these benefits make this very private yard a world of its own as soon as you close that front door. However when you do choose to venture out, a totally different lifestyle awaits. 

There are very friendly neighbors and a clubhouse that is so luxurious you wonder how you can afford it! It includes an indoor heated lap pool, an outdoor lagoon pool, a gym, library, arts and craft room, bar, billiard table, stage and cabaret floor, coffee lounge and a bistro offering free weekly meals. The bowls green is carpeted and is fully covered with a state of the art roofing and lighting system. It is arguably the best bowls green in Hervey Bay. The resort also offers daily activities including lawn bowls, zumba, personal gym trainer, yoga, cards, aqua aerobics, line dancing, shopping trips in the resort bus, happy hours, recreational trips. There is also a well equipped workshop for the budding handyman. 

The home is situated on what may be called a perpetual lease that is governed by legislation securing the owner's tenure. Instead of body corporate fees, the owner pays a site fee under the lease. Although similar to body corp fees, it is in reality a site rental and therefore attracts Centrelink rent assistance, making the weekly fee very affordable. This fee includes the rates on the property as well as maintenance of facilities and front yard maintenance. 

The resort is gated with a state of the art intercom system. It is A+ in luxury with too many features to list comprehensively. The owner pays no entry or exit fees and keeps 100% of the capital gain. The temperate climate of the coastal community of Hervey Bay makes this pet-friendly resort very attractive to residents in the southern states seeking an idyllic lifestyle.

You will need this code when calling about this property.
